intro: Yucca gloriosa var. variegata, commonly known as the Variegated Spanish Dagger, is a striking evergreen perennial native to the southwestern United States. It features tall, sword-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow streaks, adding visual interest to landscapes. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences of white or pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its drought tolerance and architectural form make it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
